Classes/AWSFirehoseVpcConfigurationDescr.name: roleARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseVpcConfigurationDescr.abstract:
The ARN of the IAM role that the delivery stream uses to create endpoints in the destination VPC. You can use your existing Kinesis Data Firehose delivery role or you can specify a new role. In either case, make sure that the role trusts the Kinesis Data Firehose service principal and that it grants the following permissions:

  • ec2:DescribeVpcs

  • ec2:DescribeVpcAttribute

  • ec2:DescribeSubnets

  • ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups

  • ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces

  • ec2:CreateNetworkInterface

  • ec2:CreateNetworkInterfacePermission

  • ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface

If you revoke these permissions after you create the delivery stream, Kinesis Data Firehose can’t scale out by creating more ENIs when necessary. You might therefore see a degradation in performance.

Classes/AWSFirehoseVpcConfigurationDescr.name: securityGroupIds
Classes/AWSFirehoseVpcConfigurationDescr.abstract: The IDs of the security groups that Kinesis Data Firehose uses when it creates ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. You can use the same security group that the Amazon ES domain uses or different ones. If you specify different security groups, ensure that they allow outbound HTTPS traffic to the Amazon ES domain’s security group. Also ensure that the Amazon ES domain’s security group allows HTTPS traffic from the security groups specified here. If you use the same security group for both your delivery stream and the Amazon ES domain, make sure the security group inbound rule allows HTTPS traffic. For more information about security group rules, see Security group rules in the Amazon VPC documentation.

Classes/AWSFirehoseVpcConfigurationDescr.name: subnetIds
Classes/AWSFirehoseVpcConfigurationDescr.abstract:
The IDs of the subnets that Kinesis Data Firehose uses to create ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon ES destination. Make sure that the routing tables and inbound and outbound rules allow traffic to flow from the subnets whose IDs are specified here to the subnets that have the destination Amazon ES endpoints. Kinesis Data Firehose creates at least one ENI in each of the subnets that are specified here. Do not delete or modify these ENIs.

The number of ENIs that Kinesis Data Firehose creates in the subnets specified here scales up and down automatically based on throughput. To enable Kinesis Data Firehose to scale up the number of ENIs to match throughput, ensure that you have sufficient quota. To help you calculate the quota you need, assume that Kinesis Data Firehose can create up to three ENIs for this delivery stream for each of the subnets specified here. For more information about ENI quota, see Network Interfaces in the Amazon VPC Quotas topic.

Classes/AWSFirehoseVpcConfigurationDescr.name: vpcId
Classes/AWSFirehoseVpcConfigurationDescr.abstract: The ID of the Amazon ES destination’s VPC.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSplunkDestinationUpda.name: s3BackupMode
Classes/AWSFirehoseSplunkDestinationUpda.abstract:
Specifies how you want Kinesis Data Firehose to back up documents to Amazon S3. When set to FailedDocumentsOnly, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any data that could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3 destination. When set to AllEvents, Kinesis Data Firehose delivers all incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed documents to Amazon S3. The default value is FailedEventsOnly.

You can update this backup mode from FailedEventsOnly to AllEvents. You can’t update it from AllEvents to FailedEventsOnly.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSplunkDestinationConf.abstract: The configuration for the backup Amazon S3 location.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSplunkBufferingHints..name: intervalInSeconds
Classes/AWSFirehoseSplunkBufferingHints..abstract: Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 60 (1 minute).

Classes/AWSFirehoseSplunkBufferingHints..name: sizeInMBs
Classes/AWSFirehoseSplunkBufferingHints..abstract: Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MBs, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 5.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSourceDescription.htm.name: kinesisStreamSourceDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseSourceDescription.htm.abstract: The KinesisStreamSourceDescription value for the source Kinesis data stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSourceDescription.htm.name: MSKSourceDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseSourceDescription.htm.abstract: The configuration description for the Amazon MSK cluster to be used as the source for a delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSerializer.html#/c:ob.name: orcSerDe
Classes/AWSFirehoseSerializer.html#/c:ob.abstract: A serializer to use for converting data to the ORC format before storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see Apache ORC.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSerializer.html#/c:ob.name: parquetSerDe
Classes/AWSFirehoseSerializer.html#/c:ob.abstract: A serializer to use for converting data to the Parquet format before storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see Apache Parquet.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSchemaConfiguration.h.name: catalogId
Classes/AWSFirehoseSchemaConfiguration.h.abstract: The ID of the Amazon Web Services Glue Data Catalog. If you don’t supply this, the Amazon Web Services account ID is used by default.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSchemaConfiguration.h.name: databaseName
Classes/AWSFirehoseSchemaConfiguration.h.abstract:
Specifies the name of the Amazon Web Services Glue database that contains the schema for the output data.

If the SchemaConfiguration request parameter is used as part of invoking the CreateDeliveryStream API, then the DatabaseName property is required and its value must be specified.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSchemaConfiguration.h.name: region
Classes/AWSFirehoseSchemaConfiguration.h.abstract: If you don’t specify an Amazon Web Services Region, the default is the current Region.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSchemaConfiguration.h.name: roleARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseSchemaConfiguration.h.abstract:
The role that Kinesis Data Firehose can use to access Amazon Web Services Glue. This role must be in the same account you use for Kinesis Data Firehose. Cross-account roles aren’t allowed.

If the SchemaConfiguration request parameter is used as part of invoking the CreateDeliveryStream API, then the RoleARN property is required and its value must be specified.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSchemaConfiguration.h.name: tableName
Classes/AWSFirehoseSchemaConfiguration.h.abstract:
Specifies the Amazon Web Services Glue table that contains the column information that constitutes your data schema.

If the SchemaConfiguration request parameter is used as part of invoking the CreateDeliveryStream API, then the TableName property is required and its value must be specified.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSchemaConfiguration.h.name: versionId
Classes/AWSFirehoseSchemaConfiguration.h.abstract: Specifies the table version for the output data schema. If you don’t specify this version ID, or if you set it to LATEST, Kinesis Data Firehose uses the most recent version. This means that any updates to the table are automatically picked up.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.name: bucketARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.abstract: The ARN of the S3 bucket. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.name: bufferingHints
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.abstract: The buffering option. If no value is specified, BufferingHints object default values are used.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.name: cloudWatchLoggingOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.abstract: The CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.name: compressionFormat
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.abstract:
The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is UNCOMPRESSED.

The compression formats SNAPPY or ZIP cannot be specified for Amazon Redshift destinations because they are not supported by the Amazon Redshift COPY operation that reads from the S3 bucket.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.name: encryptionConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.abstract: The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is no encryption.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.name: errorOutputPrefix
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.abstract: A prefix that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this prefix, see Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.name: prefix
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.abstract: The “YYYY/MM/DD/HH” time format prefix is automatically used for delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as described in Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.name: roleARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services credentials. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationDescript.name: bucketARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationDescript.abstract: The ARN of the S3 bucket. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationDescript.name: bufferingHints
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationDescript.abstract: The buffering option. If no value is specified, BufferingHints object default values are used.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationDescript.name: cloudWatchLoggingOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationDescript.abstract: The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationDescript.name: compressionFormat
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationDescript.abstract: The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is UNCOMPRESSED.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationDescript.name: encryptionConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationDescript.abstract: The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is no encryption.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationDescript.name: errorOutputPrefix
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationDescript.abstract: A prefix that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this prefix, see Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationDescript.name: prefix
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationDescript.abstract: The “YYYY/MM/DD/HH” time format prefix is automatically used for delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as described in Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationDescript.name: roleARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationDescript.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services credentials. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.name: bucketARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.abstract: The ARN of the S3 bucket. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.name: bufferingHints
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.abstract: The buffering option. If no value is specified, BufferingHints object default values are used.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.name: cloudWatchLoggingOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.abstract: The CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.name: compressionFormat
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.abstract:
The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is UNCOMPRESSED.

The compression formats SNAPPY or ZIP cannot be specified for Amazon Redshift destinations because they are not supported by the Amazon Redshift COPY operation that reads from the S3 bucket.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.name: encryptionConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.abstract: The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is no encryption.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.name: errorOutputPrefix
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.abstract: A prefix that Kinesis Data Firehose evaluates and adds to failed records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this prefix, see Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.name: prefix
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.abstract: The “YYYY/MM/DD/HH” time format prefix is automatically used for delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as described in Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.name: roleARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services credentials. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRetryOptions.html#/c:.name: durationInSeconds
Classes/AWSFirehoseRetryOptions.html#/c:.abstract: The period of time during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries to deliver data to the specified Amazon S3 prefix.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftRetryOptions..name: durationInSeconds
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftRetryOptions..abstract: The length of time during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries delivery after a failure, starting from the initial request and including the first attempt. The default value is 3600 seconds (60 minutes). Kinesis Data Firehose does not retry if the value of DurationInSeconds is 0 (zero) or if the first delivery attempt takes longer than the current value.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationUp.name: cloudWatchLoggingOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationUp.abstract: The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationUp.name: retryOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationUp.abstract: The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver documents to Amazon Redshift. Default value is 3600 (60 minutes).

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationUp.name: roleARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationUp.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services credentials. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationUp.name: s3BackupMode
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationUp.abstract: You can update a delivery stream to enable Amazon S3 backup if it is disabled. If backup is enabled, you can’t update the delivery stream to disable it.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationUp.name: s3Update
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationUp.abstract:
The Amazon S3 destination.

The compression formats SNAPPY or ZIP cannot be specified in RedshiftDestinationUpdate.S3Update because the Amazon Redshift COPY operation that reads from the S3 bucket doesn’t support these compression formats.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationDe.name: cloudWatchLoggingOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationDe.abstract: The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationDe.name: retryOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationDe.abstract: The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver documents to Amazon Redshift. Default value is 3600 (60 minutes).

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationDe.name: roleARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationDe.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services credentials. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationDe.name: s3BackupDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationDe.abstract: The configuration for backup in Amazon S3.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationCo.name: cloudWatchLoggingOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationCo.abstract: The CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationCo.name: retryOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationCo.abstract: The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver documents to Amazon Redshift. Default value is 3600 (60 minutes).

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationCo.name: roleARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationCo.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services credentials. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationCo.name: s3BackupConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationCo.abstract: The configuration for backup in Amazon S3.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationCo.name: s3BackupMode
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationCo.abstract: The Amazon S3 backup mode. After you create a delivery stream, you can update it to enable Amazon S3 backup if it is disabled. If backup is enabled, you can’t update the delivery stream to disable it.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationCo.name: s3Configuration
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationCo.abstract:
The configuration for the intermediate Amazon S3 location from which Amazon Redshift obtains data. Restrictions are described in the topic for CreateDeliveryStream.

The compression formats SNAPPY or ZIP cannot be specified in RedshiftDestinationConfiguration.S3Configuration because the Amazon Redshift COPY operation that reads from the S3 bucket doesn’t support these compression formats.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRecord.html#/c:objc(c.name: data
Classes/AWSFirehoseRecord.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: The data blob, which is base64-encoded when the blob is serialized. The maximum size of the data blob, before base64-encoding, is 1,000 KiB.

Classes/AWSFirehosePutRecordOutput.html#.name: encrypted
Classes/AWSFirehosePutRecordOutput.html#.abstract: Indicates whether server-side encryption (SSE) was enabled during this operation.

Classes/AWSFirehosePutRecordBatchRespons.name: errorCode
Classes/AWSFirehosePutRecordBatchRespons.abstract: The error code for an individual record result.

Classes/AWSFirehosePutRecordBatchRespons.name: errorMessage
Classes/AWSFirehosePutRecordBatchRespons.abstract: The error message for an individual record result.

Classes/AWSFirehosePutRecordBatchOutput..name: encrypted
Classes/AWSFirehosePutRecordBatchOutput..abstract: Indicates whether server-side encryption (SSE) was enabled during this operation.

Classes/AWSFirehosePutRecordBatchOutput..name: failedPutCount
Classes/AWSFirehosePutRecordBatchOutput..abstract: The number of records that might have failed processing. This number might be greater than 0 even if the PutRecordBatch call succeeds. Check FailedPutCount to determine whether there are records that you need to resend.

Classes/AWSFirehosePutRecordBatchOutput..name: requestResponses
Classes/AWSFirehosePutRecordBatchOutput..abstract: The results array. For each record, the index of the response element is the same as the index used in the request array.

Classes/AWSFirehoseProcessorParameter.ht.name: parameterName
Classes/AWSFirehoseProcessorParameter.ht.abstract: The name of the parameter. Currently the following default values are supported: 3 for NumberOfRetries and 60 for the BufferIntervalInSeconds. The BufferSizeInMBs ranges between 0.2 MB and up to 3MB. The default buffering hint is 1MB for all destinations, except Splunk. For Splunk, the default buffering hint is 256 KB.

Classes/AWSFirehoseParquetSerDe.html#/c:.name: blockSizeBytes
Classes/AWSFirehoseParquetSerDe.html#/c:.abstract: The Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) block size. This is useful if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is 256 MiB and the minimum is 64 MiB. Kinesis Data Firehose uses this value for padding calculations.

Classes/AWSFirehoseParquetSerDe.html#/c:.name: compression
Classes/AWSFirehoseParquetSerDe.html#/c:.abstract: The compression code to use over data blocks. The possible values are UNCOMPRESSED, SNAPPY, and GZIP, with the default being SNAPPY. Use SNAPPY for higher decompression speed. Use GZIP if the compression ratio is more important than speed.

Classes/AWSFirehoseParquetSerDe.html#/c:.name: maxPaddingBytes
Classes/AWSFirehoseParquetSerDe.html#/c:.abstract: The maximum amount of padding to apply. This is useful if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is 0.

Classes/AWSFirehoseParquetSerDe.html#/c:.name: pageSizeBytes
Classes/AWSFirehoseParquetSerDe.html#/c:.abstract: The Parquet page size. Column chunks are divided into pages. A page is conceptually an indivisible unit (in terms of compression and encoding). The minimum value is 64 KiB and the default is 1 MiB.

Classes/AWSFirehoseParquetSerDe.html#/c:.name: writerVersion
Classes/AWSFirehoseParquetSerDe.html#/c:.abstract: Indicates the version of row format to output. The possible values are V1 and V2. The default is V1.

Classes/AWSFirehoseOutputFormatConfigura.name: serializer
Classes/AWSFirehoseOutputFormatConfigura.abstract: Specifies which serializer to use. You can choose either the ORC SerDe or the Parquet SerDe. If both are non-null, the server rejects the request.

Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.name: blockSizeBytes
Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.abstract: The Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) block size. This is useful if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is 256 MiB and the minimum is 64 MiB. Kinesis Data Firehose uses this value for padding calculations.

Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.name: bloomFilterColumns
Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.abstract: The column names for which you want Kinesis Data Firehose to create bloom filters. The default is null.

Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.name: bloomFilterFalsePositiveProbability
Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.abstract: The Bloom filter false positive probability (FPP). The lower the FPP, the bigger the Bloom filter. The default value is 0.05, the minimum is 0, and the maximum is 1.

Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.name: compression
Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.abstract: The compression code to use over data blocks. The default is SNAPPY.

Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.name: dictionaryKeyThreshold
Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.abstract: Represents the fraction of the total number of non-null rows. To turn off dictionary encoding, set this fraction to a number that is less than the number of distinct keys in a dictionary. To always use dictionary encoding, set this threshold to 1.

Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.name: enablePadding
Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.abstract: Set this to true to indicate that you want stripes to be padded to the HDFS block boundaries. This is useful if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is false.

Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.name: formatVersion
Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.abstract: The version of the file to write. The possible values are V0_11 and V0_12. The default is V0_12.

Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.name: paddingTolerance
Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.abstract:
A number between 0 and 1 that defines the tolerance for block padding as a decimal fraction of stripe size. The default value is 0.05, which means 5 percent of stripe size.

For the default values of 64 MiB ORC stripes and 256 MiB HDFS blocks, the default block padding tolerance of 5 percent reserves a maximum of 3.2 MiB for padding within the 256 MiB block. In such a case, if the available size within the block is more than 3.2 MiB, a new, smaller stripe is inserted to fit within that space. This ensures that no stripe crosses block boundaries and causes remote reads within a node-local task.

Kinesis Data Firehose ignores this parameter when OrcSerDe$EnablePadding is false.

Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.name: rowIndexStride
Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.abstract: The number of rows between index entries. The default is 10,000 and the minimum is 1,000.

Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.name: stripeSizeBytes
Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html#/c:objc.abstract: The number of bytes in each stripe. The default is 64 MiB and the minimum is 8 MiB.

Classes/AWSFirehoseOpenXJsonSerDe.html#/.name: caseInsensitive
Classes/AWSFirehoseOpenXJsonSerDe.html#/.abstract: When set to true, which is the default, Kinesis Data Firehose converts JSON keys to lowercase before deserializing them.

Classes/AWSFirehoseOpenXJsonSerDe.html#/.name: columnToJsonKeyMappings
Classes/AWSFirehoseOpenXJsonSerDe.html#/.abstract: Maps column names to JSON keys that aren’t identical to the column names. This is useful when the JSON contains keys that are Hive keywords. For example, timestamp is a Hive keyword. If you have a JSON key named timestamp, set this parameter to {"ts": "timestamp"} to map this key to a column named ts.

Classes/AWSFirehoseOpenXJsonSerDe.html#/.name: convertDotsInJsonKeysToUnderscores
Classes/AWSFirehoseOpenXJsonSerDe.html#/.abstract:
When set to true, specifies that the names of the keys include dots and that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to replace them with underscores. This is useful because Apache Hive does not allow dots in column names. For example, if the JSON contains a key whose name is “a.b”, you can define the column name to be “a_b” when using this option.

The default is false.

Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceDescription..name: authenticationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceDescription..abstract: The authentication configuration of the Amazon MSK cluster.

Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceDescription..name: deliveryStartTimestamp
Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceDescription..abstract: Kinesis Data Firehose starts retrieving records from the topic within the Amazon MSK cluster starting with this timestamp.

Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceDescription..name: MSKClusterARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceDescription..abstract: The ARN of the Amazon MSK cluster.

Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceDescription..name: topicName
Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceDescription..abstract: The topic name within the Amazon MSK cluster.

Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceConfiguratio.name: authenticationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceConfiguratio.abstract: The authentication configuration of the Amazon MSK cluster.

Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceConfiguratio.name: MSKClusterARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceConfiguratio.abstract: The ARN of the Amazon MSK cluster.

Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceConfiguratio.name: topicName
Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceConfiguratio.abstract: The topic name within the Amazon MSK cluster.

Classes/AWSFirehoseListTagsForDeliverySt.name: hasMoreTags
Classes/AWSFirehoseListTagsForDeliverySt.abstract: If this is true in the response, more tags are available. To list the remaining tags, set ExclusiveStartTagKey to the key of the last tag returned and call ListTagsForDeliveryStream again.

Classes/AWSFirehoseListTagsForDeliverySt.name: tags
Classes/AWSFirehoseListTagsForDeliverySt.abstract: A list of tags associated with DeliveryStreamName, starting with the first tag after ExclusiveStartTagKey and up to the specified Limit.

Classes/AWSFirehoseListTagsForDeliverySt.name: deliveryStreamName
Classes/AWSFirehoseListTagsForDeliverySt.abstract: The name of the delivery stream whose tags you want to list.

Classes/AWSFirehoseListTagsForDeliverySt.name: exclusiveStartTagKey
Classes/AWSFirehoseListTagsForDeliverySt.abstract: The key to use as the starting point for the list of tags. If you set this parameter, ListTagsForDeliveryStream gets all tags that occur after ExclusiveStartTagKey.

Classes/AWSFirehoseListTagsForDeliverySt.name: limit
Classes/AWSFirehoseListTagsForDeliverySt.abstract: The number of tags to return. If this number is less than the total number of tags associated with the delivery stream, HasMoreTags is set to true in the response. To list additional tags, set ExclusiveStartTagKey to the last key in the response.

Classes/AWSFirehoseListDeliveryStreamsOu.name: hasMoreDeliveryStreams
Classes/AWSFirehoseListDeliveryStreamsOu.abstract: Indicates whether there are more delivery streams available to list.

Classes/AWSFirehoseListDeliveryStreamsIn.name: deliveryStreamType
Classes/AWSFirehoseListDeliveryStreamsIn.abstract:
The delivery stream type. This can be one of the following values:

  • DirectPut: Provider applications access the delivery stream directly.

  • KinesisStreamAsSource: The delivery stream uses a Kinesis data stream as a source.

This parameter is optional. If this parameter is omitted, delivery streams of all types are returned.

Classes/AWSFirehoseListDeliveryStreamsIn.name: exclusiveStartDeliveryStreamName
Classes/AWSFirehoseListDeliveryStreamsIn.abstract: The list of delivery streams returned by this call to ListDeliveryStreams will start with the delivery stream whose name comes alphabetically immediately after the name you specify in ExclusiveStartDeliveryStreamName.

Classes/AWSFirehoseListDeliveryStreamsIn.name: limit
Classes/AWSFirehoseListDeliveryStreamsIn.abstract: The maximum number of delivery streams to list. The default value is 10.

Classes/AWSFirehoseKinesisStreamSourceDe.name: deliveryStartTimestamp
Classes/AWSFirehoseKinesisStreamSourceDe.abstract: Kinesis Data Firehose starts retrieving records from the Kinesis data stream starting with this timestamp.

Classes/AWSFirehoseKinesisStreamSourceDe.name: kinesisStreamARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseKinesisStreamSourceDe.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source Kinesis data stream. For more information, see Amazon Kinesis Data Streams ARN Format.

Classes/AWSFirehoseKinesisStreamSourceDe.name: roleARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseKinesisStreamSourceDe.abstract: The ARN of the role used by the source Kinesis data stream. For more information, see Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM) ARN Format.

Classes/AWSFirehoseKinesisStreamSourceCo.name: kinesisStreamARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseKinesisStreamSourceCo.abstract: The ARN of the source Kinesis data stream. For more information, see Amazon Kinesis Data Streams ARN Format.

Classes/AWSFirehoseKinesisStreamSourceCo.name: roleARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseKinesisStreamSourceCo.abstract: The ARN of the role that provides access to the source Kinesis data stream. For more information, see Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM) ARN Format.

Classes/AWSFirehoseKMSEncryptionConfig.h.name: AWSKMSKeyARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseKMSEncryptionConfig.h.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the encryption key. Must belong to the same Amazon Web Services Region as the destination Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

Classes/AWSFirehoseInputFormatConfigurat.name: deserializer
Classes/AWSFirehoseInputFormatConfigurat.abstract: Specifies which deserializer to use. You can choose either the Apache Hive JSON SerDe or the OpenX JSON SerDe. If both are non-null, the server rejects the request.

Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointRetryOpti.name: durationInSeconds
Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointRetryOpti.abstract: The total amount of time that Kinesis Data Firehose spends on retries. This duration starts after the initial attempt to send data to the custom destination via HTTPS endpoint fails. It doesn’t include the periods during which Kinesis Data Firehose waits for acknowledgment from the specified destination after each attempt.

Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointRequestCo.name: commonAttributes
Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointRequestCo.abstract: Describes the metadata sent to the HTTP endpoint destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointRequestCo.name: contentEncoding
Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointRequestCo.abstract: Kinesis Data Firehose uses the content encoding to compress the body of a request before sending the request to the destination. For more information, see Content-Encoding in MDN Web Docs, the official Mozilla documentation.

Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointDestinati.name: bufferingHints
Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointDestinati.abstract: Describes buffering options that can be applied to the data before it is delivered to the HTTPS endpoint destination. Kinesis Data Firehose teats these options as hints, and it might choose to use more optimal values. The SizeInMBs and IntervalInSeconds parameters are optional. However, if specify a value for one of them, you must also provide a value for the other.

Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointDestinati.name: cloudWatchLoggingOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointDestinati.abstract: Describes the Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointBuffering.abstract:
Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MBs, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 5.

Classes/AWSFirehoseElasticsearchDestinat.abstract:
The Elasticsearch type name. For Elasticsearch 6.x, there can be only one type per index. If you try to specify a new type for an existing index that already has another type, Kinesis Data Firehose returns an error during runtime.

If you upgrade Elasticsearch from 6.x to 7.x and don’t update your delivery stream, Kinesis Data Firehose still delivers data to Elasticsearch with the old index name and type name. If you want to update your delivery stream with a new index name, provide an empty string for TypeName.

Classes/AWSFirehoseElasticsearchDestinat.name: s3BackupMode
Classes/AWSFirehoseElasticsearchDestinat.abstract:
Defines how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When it is set to FailedDocumentsOnly, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any documents that could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3 destination, with AmazonOpenSearchService-failed/ appended to the key prefix. When set to AllDocuments, Kinesis Data Firehose delivers all incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed documents with AmazonOpenSearchService-failed/ appended to the prefix. For more information, see Amazon S3 Backup for the Amazon ES Destination. Default value is FailedDocumentsOnly.

You can’t change this backup mode after you create the delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseElasticsearchDestinat.abstract:
The Elasticsearch type name. For Elasticsearch 6.x, there can be only one type per index. If you try to specify a new type for an existing index that already has another type, Kinesis Data Firehose returns an error during run time.

For Elasticsearch 7.x, don’t specify a TypeName.

Classes/AWSFirehoseElasticsearchBufferin.abstract: Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).

Classes/AWSFirehoseElasticsearchBufferin.name: sizeInMBs
Classes/AWSFirehoseElasticsearchBufferin.abstract:
Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MBs, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 5.

We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds. For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MB/sec, the value should be 10 MB or higher.
