Classes/AWSFirehoseDynamicPartitioningCo.abstract: Specifies that the dynamic partitioning is enabled for this Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDynamicPartitioningCo.name: retryOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseDynamicPartitioningCo.abstract: The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver data to an Amazon S3 prefix.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDocumentIdOptions.htm.name: defaultDocumentIdFormat
Classes/AWSFirehoseDocumentIdOptions.htm.abstract:
When the FIREHOSE_DEFAULT option is chosen, Kinesis Data Firehose generates a unique document ID for each record based on a unique internal identifier. The generated document ID is stable across multiple delivery attempts, which helps prevent the same record from being indexed multiple times with different document IDs.

When the NO_DOCUMENT_ID option is chosen, Kinesis Data Firehose does not include any document IDs in the requests it sends to the Amazon OpenSearch Service. This causes the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain to generate document IDs. In case of multiple delivery attempts, this may cause the same record to be indexed more than once with different document IDs. This option enables write-heavy operations, such as the ingestion of logs and observability data, to consume less resources in the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain, resulting in improved performance.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDestinationDescriptio.name: amazonOpenSearchServerlessDestinationDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseDestinationDescriptio.abstract: The destination in the Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeserializer.html#/c:.name: hiveJsonSerDe
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeserializer.html#/c:.abstract: The native Hive / HCatalog JsonSerDe. Used by Kinesis Data Firehose for deserializing data, which means converting it from the JSON format in preparation for serializing it to the Parquet or ORC format. This is one of two deserializers you can choose, depending on which one offers the functionality you need. The other option is the OpenX SerDe.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeserializer.html#/c:.name: openXJsonSerDe
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeserializer.html#/c:.abstract: The OpenX SerDe. Used by Kinesis Data Firehose for deserializing data, which means converting it from the JSON format in preparation for serializing it to the Parquet or ORC format. This is one of two deserializers you can choose, depending on which one offers the functionality you need. The other option is the native Hive / HCatalog JsonSerDe.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDescribeDeliveryStrea.name: exclusiveStartDestinationId
Classes/AWSFirehoseDescribeDeliveryStrea.abstract: The ID of the destination to start returning the destination information. Kinesis Data Firehose supports one destination per delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDescribeDeliveryStrea.name: limit
Classes/AWSFirehoseDescribeDeliveryStrea.abstract: The limit on the number of destinations to return. You can have one destination per delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncrypt.name: keyARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncrypt.abstract: If you set KeyType to CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK, you must specify the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK. If you set KeyType to Amazon Web Services_OWNED_CMK, Kinesis Data Firehose uses a service-account CMK.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncrypt.name: keyType
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncrypt.abstract:
Indicates the type of customer master key (CMK) to use for encryption. The default setting is Amazon Web Services_OWNED_CMK. For more information about CMKs, see Customer Master Keys (CMKs). When you invoke CreateDeliveryStream or StartDeliveryStreamEncryption with KeyType set to CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK, Kinesis Data Firehose invokes the Amazon KMS operation CreateGrant to create a grant that allows the Kinesis Data Firehose service to use the customer managed CMK to perform encryption and decryption. Kinesis Data Firehose manages that grant.

When you invoke StartDeliveryStreamEncryption to change the CMK for a delivery stream that is encrypted with a customer managed CMK, Kinesis Data Firehose schedules the grant it had on the old CMK for retirement.

You can use a CMK of type CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK to encrypt up to 500 delivery streams. If a CreateDeliveryStream or StartDeliveryStreamEncryption operation exceeds this limit, Kinesis Data Firehose throws a LimitExceededException.

To encrypt your delivery stream, use symmetric CMKs. Kinesis Data Firehose doesn’t support asymmetric CMKs. For information about symmetric and asymmetric CMKs, see About Symmetric and Asymmetric CMKs in the Amazon Web Services Key Management Service developer guide.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncrypt.name: failureDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncrypt.abstract: Provides details in case one of the following operations fails due to an error related to KMS: CreateDeliveryStream, DeleteDeliveryStream, StartDeliveryStreamEncryption, StopDeliveryStreamEncryption.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncrypt.name: keyARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncrypt.abstract: If KeyType is CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK, this field contains the ARN of the customer managed CMK. If KeyType is Amazon Web Services_OWNED_CMK, DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration doesn’t contain a value for KeyARN.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncrypt.name: keyType
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncrypt.abstract: Indicates the type of customer master key (CMK) that is used for encryption. The default setting is Amazon Web Services_OWNED_CMK. For more information about CMKs, see Customer Master Keys (CMKs).

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncrypt.name: status
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncrypt.abstract: This is the server-side encryption (SSE) status for the delivery stream. For a full description of the different values of this status, see StartDeliveryStreamEncryption and StopDeliveryStreamEncryption. If this status is ENABLING_FAILED or DISABLING_FAILED, it is the status of the most recent attempt to enable or disable SSE, respectively.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.name: createTimestamp
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.abstract: The date and time that the delivery stream was created.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.name: deliveryStreamARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the delivery stream. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.name: deliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.abstract: Indicates the server-side encryption (SSE) status for the delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.name: deliveryStreamStatus
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.abstract: The status of the delivery stream. If the status of a delivery stream is CREATING_FAILED, this status doesn’t change, and you can’t invoke CreateDeliveryStream again on it. However, you can invoke the DeleteDeliveryStream operation to delete it.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.name: deliveryStreamType
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.abstract:
The delivery stream type. This can be one of the following values:

  • DirectPut: Provider applications access the delivery stream directly.

  • KinesisStreamAsSource: The delivery stream uses a Kinesis data stream as a source.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.name: failureDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.abstract: Provides details in case one of the following operations fails due to an error related to KMS: CreateDeliveryStream, DeleteDeliveryStream, StartDeliveryStreamEncryption, StopDeliveryStreamEncryption.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.name: hasMoreDestinations
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.abstract: Indicates whether there are more destinations available to list.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.name: lastUpdateTimestamp
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.abstract: The date and time that the delivery stream was last updated.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.name: source
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.abstract: If the DeliveryStreamType parameter is KinesisStreamAsSource, a SourceDescription object describing the source Kinesis data stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.name: versionId
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamDescrip.abstract: Each time the destination is updated for a delivery stream, the version ID is changed, and the current version ID is required when updating the destination. This is so that the service knows it is applying the changes to the correct version of the delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeleteDeliveryStreamI.name: allowForceDelete
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeleteDeliveryStreamI.abstract:
Set this to true if you want to delete the delivery stream even if Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to retire the grant for the CMK. Kinesis Data Firehose might be unable to retire the grant due to a customer error, such as when the CMK or the grant are in an invalid state. If you force deletion, you can then use the RevokeGrant operation to revoke the grant you gave to Kinesis Data Firehose. If a failure to retire the grant happens due to an Amazon Web Services KMS issue, Kinesis Data Firehose keeps retrying the delete operation.

The default value is false.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDataFormatConversionC.name: enabled
Classes/AWSFirehoseDataFormatConversionC.abstract: Defaults to true. Set it to false if you want to disable format conversion while preserving the configuration details.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDataFormatConversionC.name: inputFormatConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseDataFormatConversionC.abstract: Specifies the deserializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to convert the format of your data from JSON. This parameter is required if Enabled is set to true.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDataFormatConversionC.name: outputFormatConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseDataFormatConversionC.abstract: Specifies the serializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to convert the format of your data to the Parquet or ORC format. This parameter is required if Enabled is set to true.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDataFormatConversionC.name: schemaConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseDataFormatConversionC.abstract: Specifies the Amazon Web Services Glue Data Catalog table that contains the column information. This parameter is required if Enabled is set to true.

Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.name: amazonOpenSearchServerlessDestinationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.abstract: The destination in the Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service. You can specify only one destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.name: amazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.abstract: The destination in Amazon OpenSearch Service. You can specify only one destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.name: deliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput
Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.abstract: Used to specify the type and Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key needed for Server-Side Encryption (SSE).

Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.name: deliveryStreamName
Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.abstract: The name of the delivery stream. This name must be unique per Amazon Web Services account in the same Amazon Web Services Region. If the delivery streams are in different accounts or different Regions, you can have multiple delivery streams with the same name.

Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.name: deliveryStreamType
Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.abstract:
The delivery stream type. This parameter can be one of the following values:

  • DirectPut: Provider applications access the delivery stream directly.

  • KinesisStreamAsSource: The delivery stream uses a Kinesis data stream as a source.

Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.name: elasticsearchDestinationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.abstract: The destination in Amazon ES. You can specify only one destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.name: extendedS3DestinationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.abstract: The destination in Amazon S3. You can specify only one destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.name: httpEndpointDestinationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.abstract: Enables configuring Kinesis Firehose to deliver data to any HTTP endpoint destination. You can specify only one destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.name: kinesisStreamSourceConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.abstract: When a Kinesis data stream is used as the source for the delivery stream, a KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration containing the Kinesis data stream Amazon Resource Name (ARN) and the role ARN for the source stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.name: MSKSourceConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.abstract: The configuration for the Amazon MSK cluster to be used as the source for a delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.name: redshiftDestinationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.abstract: The destination in Amazon Redshift. You can specify only one destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.name: s3DestinationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.abstract: [Deprecated] The destination in Amazon S3. You can specify only one destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.name: splunkDestinationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.abstract: The destination in Splunk. You can specify only one destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.name: tags
Classes/AWSFirehoseCreateDeliveryStreamI.abstract:
A set of tags to assign to the delivery stream. A tag is a key-value pair that you can define and assign to Amazon Web Services resources. Tags are metadata. For example, you can add friendly names and descriptions or other types of information that can help you distinguish the delivery stream. For more information about tags, see Using Cost Allocation Tags in the Amazon Web Services Billing and Cost Management User Guide.

You can specify up to 50 tags when creating a delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseReplicateCommand.html.name: replicateOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseReplicateCommand.html.abstract:
Optional parameters to use with the Amazon Redshift COPY command. For more information, see the “Optional Parameters” section of Amazon Redshift COPY command. Some possible examples that would apply to Kinesis Data Firehose are as follows:

delimiter '\t' lzop; - fields are delimited with “\t” (TAB character) and compressed using lzop.

delimiter '|' - fields are delimited with “|” (this is the default delimiter).

delimiter '|' escape - the delimiter should be escaped.

fixedwidth 'venueid:3,venuename:25,venuecity:12,venuestate:2,venueseats:6' - fields are fixed width in the source, with each width specified after every column in the table.

JSON 's3://mybucket/jsonpaths.txt' - data is in JSON format, and the path specified is the format of the data.

For more examples, see Amazon Redshift COPY command examples.

Classes/AWSFirehoseReplicateCommand.html.name: dataTableName
Classes/AWSFirehoseReplicateCommand.html.abstract: The name of the target table. The table must already exist in the database.

Classes/AWSFirehoseCloudWatchLoggingOpti.name: logGroupName
Classes/AWSFirehoseCloudWatchLoggingOpti.abstract: The CloudWatch group name for logging. This value is required if CloudWatch logging is enabled.

Classes/AWSFirehoseCloudWatchLoggingOpti.name: logStreamName
Classes/AWSFirehoseCloudWatchLoggingOpti.abstract: The CloudWatch log stream name for logging. This value is required if CloudWatch logging is enabled.

Classes/AWSFirehoseBufferingHints.html#/.name: intervalInSeconds
Classes/AWSFirehoseBufferingHints.html#/.abstract: Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 300. This parameter is optional but if you specify a value for it, you must also specify a value for SizeInMBs, and vice versa.

Classes/AWSFirehoseBufferingHints.html#/.name: sizeInMBs
Classes/AWSFirehoseBufferingHints.html#/.abstract:
Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MiBs, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 5. This parameter is optional but if you specify a value for it, you must also specify a value for IntervalInSeconds, and vice versa.

We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds. For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MiB/sec, the value should be 10 MiB or higher.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAuthenticationConfigu.name: connectivity
Classes/AWSFirehoseAuthenticationConfigu.abstract: The type of connectivity used to access the Amazon MSK cluster.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAuthenticationConfigu.name: roleARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseAuthenticationConfigu.abstract: The ARN of the role used to access the Amazon MSK cluster.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: durationInSeconds
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: After an initial failure to deliver to Amazon OpenSearch Service, the total amount of time during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries delivery (including the first attempt). After this time has elapsed, the failed documents are written to Amazon S3. Default value is 300 seconds (5 minutes). A value of 0 (zero) results in no retries.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: bufferingHints
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The buffering options. If no value is specified, AmazonopensearchBufferingHints object default values are used.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: cloudWatchLoggingOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Describes the Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: clusterEndpoint
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The endpoint to use when communicating with the cluster. Specify either this ClusterEndpoint or the DomainARN field.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: documentIdOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Indicates the method for setting up document ID. The supported methods are Kinesis Data Firehose generated document ID and OpenSearch Service generated document ID.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: domainARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The ARN of the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain. The IAM role must have permissions for DescribeDomain, DescribeDomains, and DescribeDomainConfig after assuming the IAM role specified in RoleARN.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: indexName
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The Amazon OpenSearch Service index name.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: indexRotationPeriod
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The Amazon OpenSearch Service index rotation period. Index rotation appends a timestamp to IndexName to facilitate the expiration of old data.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: processingConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Describes a data processing configuration.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: retryOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver documents to Amazon OpenSearch Service. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: roleARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to be assumed by Kinesis Data Firehose for calling the Amazon OpenSearch Service Configuration API and for indexing documents.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: s3Update
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Describes an update for a destination in Amazon S3.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: typeName
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract:
The Amazon OpenSearch Service type name. For Elasticsearch 6.x, there can be only one type per index. If you try to specify a new type for an existing index that already has another type, Kinesis Data Firehose returns an error during runtime.

If you upgrade Elasticsearch from 6.x to 7.x and don’t update your delivery stream, Kinesis Data Firehose still delivers data to Elasticsearch with the old index name and type name. If you want to update your delivery stream with a new index name, provide an empty string for TypeName.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: bufferingHints
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The buffering options.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: cloudWatchLoggingOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Describes the Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: clusterEndpoint
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The endpoint to use when communicating with the cluster. Kinesis Data Firehose uses either this ClusterEndpoint or the DomainARN field to send data to Amazon OpenSearch Service.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: documentIdOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Indicates the method for setting up document ID. The supported methods are Kinesis Data Firehose generated document ID and OpenSearch Service generated document ID.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: domainARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The ARN of the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: indexName
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The Amazon OpenSearch Service index name.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: indexRotationPeriod
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The Amazon OpenSearch Service index rotation period

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: processingConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Describes a data processing configuration.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: retryOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The Amazon OpenSearch Service retry options.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: roleARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services credentials.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: s3BackupMode
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The Amazon S3 backup mode.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: s3DestinationDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Describes a destination in Amazon S3.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: typeName
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The Amazon OpenSearch Service type name. This applies to Elasticsearch 6.x and lower versions. For Elasticsearch 7.x and OpenSearch Service 1.x, there’s no value for TypeName.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: vpcConfigurationDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The details of the VPC of the Amazon ES destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: bufferingHints
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The buffering options. If no value is specified, the default values for AmazonopensearchserviceBufferingHints are used.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: cloudWatchLoggingOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Describes the Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: clusterEndpoint
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The endpoint to use when communicating with the cluster. Specify either this ClusterEndpoint or the DomainARN field.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: documentIdOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Indicates the method for setting up document ID. The supported methods are Kinesis Data Firehose generated document ID and OpenSearch Service generated document ID.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: domainARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The ARN of the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain. The IAM role must have permissions for DescribeElasticsearchDomain, DescribeElasticsearchDomains, and DescribeElasticsearchDomainConfig after assuming the role specified in RoleARN.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: indexName
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The ElasticsearAmazon OpenSearch Service index name.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: indexRotationPeriod
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The Amazon OpenSearch Service index rotation period. Index rotation appends a timestamp to the IndexName to facilitate the expiration of old data.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: processingConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Describes a data processing configuration.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: retryOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver documents to Amazon OpenSearch Service. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: roleARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to be assumed by Kinesis Data Firehose for calling the Amazon OpenSearch Service Configuration API and for indexing documents.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: s3BackupMode
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Defines how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When it is set to FailedDocumentsOnly, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any documents that could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3 destination, with AmazonOpenSearchService-failed/ appended to the key prefix. When set to AllDocuments, Kinesis Data Firehose delivers all incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed documents with AmazonOpenSearchService-failed/ appended to the prefix.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: s3Configuration
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Describes the configuration of a destination in Amazon S3.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: typeName
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The Amazon OpenSearch Service type name. For Elasticsearch 6.x, there can be only one type per index. If you try to specify a new type for an existing index that already has another type, Kinesis Data Firehose returns an error during run time.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: vpcConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The details of the VPC of the Amazon OpenSearch or Amazon OpenSearch Serverless destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: intervalInSeconds
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: sizeInMBs
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract:
Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MBs, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 5.

We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds. For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MB/sec, the value should be 10 MB or higher.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: durationInSeconds
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: After an initial failure to deliver to the Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service, the total amount of time during which Kinesis Data Firehose retries delivery (including the first attempt). After this time has elapsed, the failed documents are written to Amazon S3. Default value is 300 seconds (5 minutes). A value of 0 (zero) results in no retries.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: bufferingHints
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The buffering options. If no value is specified, AmazonopensearchBufferingHints object default values are used.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: cloudWatchLoggingOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: Describes the Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: collectionEndpoint
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The endpoint to use when communicating with the collection in the Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: indexName
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service index name.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: processingConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: Describes a data processing configuration.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: retryOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver documents to the Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: roleARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to be assumed by Kinesis Data Firehose for calling the Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service Configuration API and for indexing documents.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: s3Update
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: Describes an update for a destination in Amazon S3.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: bufferingHints
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The buffering options.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: cloudWatchLoggingOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: Describes the Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: collectionEndpoint
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The endpoint to use when communicating with the collection in the Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: indexName
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service index name.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: processingConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: Describes a data processing configuration.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: retryOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service retry options.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: roleARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services credentials.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: s3BackupMode
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The Amazon S3 backup mode.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: s3DestinationDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: Describes a destination in Amazon S3.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: vpcConfigurationDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The details of the VPC of the Amazon ES destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: bufferingHints
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The buffering options. If no value is specified, the default values for AmazonopensearchserviceBufferingHints are used.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: cloudWatchLoggingOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: Describes the Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: collectionEndpoint
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The endpoint to use when communicating with the collection in the Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: indexName
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service index name.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: processingConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: Describes a data processing configuration.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: retryOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver documents to the Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: roleARN
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to be assumed by Kinesis Data Firehose for calling the Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service Configuration API and for indexing documents.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: s3BackupMode
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: Defines how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When it is set to FailedDocumentsOnly, Kinesis Data Firehose writes any documents that could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3 destination, with AmazonOpenSearchService-failed/ appended to the key prefix. When set to AllDocuments, Kinesis Data Firehose delivers all incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed documents with AmazonOpenSearchService-failed/ appended to the prefix.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: s3Configuration
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: Describes the configuration of a destination in Amazon S3.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: vpcConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The details of the VPC of the Amazon OpenSearch or Amazon OpenSearch Serverless destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: intervalInSeconds
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 300 (5 minutes).

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: sizeInMBs
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract:
Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MBs, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 5.

We recommend setting this parameter to a value greater than the amount of data you typically ingest into the delivery stream in 10 seconds. For example, if you typically ingest data at 1 MB/sec, the value should be 10 MB or higher.

Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html#.name: diskBytesUsed
Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html#.abstract: The number of bytes currently used to store AWSKinesisPutRecordInput objects on disk.

Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html#.name: notificationByteThreshold
Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html#.abstract: The threshold of disk bytes for notification. When exceeded, saveRecord:streamName: posts AWSKinesisRecorderByteThresholdReachedNotification. The default is 0 meaning it will not post the notification.

Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html#.name: diskByteLimit
Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html#.abstract: The limit of the disk cache size in bytes. When exceeded, older requests will be discarded. Setting this value to 0.0 meaning no practical limit. The default value is 5MB.

Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html#.name: diskAgeLimit
Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html#.abstract: The age limit of the cached requests. When exceeded, requests older than the specified age will be discarded. Setting this value to 0 meaning no practical limit. The default is no age limit.

Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html#.name: batchRecordsByteLimit
Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html#.abstract: The maxium batch data size in bytes. The default value is 512KB. The maximum is 4MB.

Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html#.name: -saveRecord:streamName:
Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html#.abstract: Saves a record to local storage to be sent later. The record will be submitted to the streamName provided with a randomly generated partition key to ensure equal distribution across shards.

Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html#.name: -saveRecord:streamName:partitionKey:
Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html#.abstract: Note: The partitionKey is used to distribute records between shards, therefore using the same partitionKey across multiple calls could cause provisioned throughput to be exceeded on one shard.

Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html#.name: -submitAllRecords
Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html#.abstract: Submits all locally saved requests to Amazon Kinesis. Requests that are successfully sent will be deleted from the device. Requests that fail due to the device being offline will stop the submission process and be kept. Requests that fail due to other reasons (such as the request being invalid) will be deleted.

Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html.name: AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder
Classes/AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder.html.abstract: AWSAbstractKinesisRecorder is an abstract class. You should not instantiate this class directly. Instead use its concrete subclasses AWSKinesisRecorder and AWSFirehoseRecorder.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServerlessBufferingHints
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: Describes the buffering to perform before delivering data to the Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServerlessDestinationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: Describes the configuration of a destination in the Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServerlessDestinationDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: The destination description in the Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServerlessDestinationUpdate
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: Describes an update for a destination in the Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.name: AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServerlessRetryOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonOpenSearchServe.abstract: Configures retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver documents to the Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchserviceBufferingHints
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Describes the buffering to perform before delivering data to the Amazon OpenSearch Service destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Describes the configuration of a destination in Amazon OpenSearch Service

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchserviceDestinationDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: The destination description in Amazon OpenSearch Service.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchserviceDestinationUpdate
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Describes an update for a destination in Amazon OpenSearch Service.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.name: AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchserviceRetryOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseAmazonopensearchservi.abstract: Configures retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver documents to Amazon OpenSearch Service.

Classes/AWSFirehoseAuthenticationConfigu.name: AWSFirehoseAuthenticationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseAuthenticationConfigu.abstract: The authentication configuration of the Amazon MSK cluster.

Classes/AWSFirehoseBufferingHints.html.name: AWSFirehoseBufferingHints
Classes/AWSFirehoseBufferingHints.html.abstract: Describes hints for the buffering to perform before delivering data to the destination. These options are treated as hints, and therefore Kinesis Data Firehose might choose to use different values when it is optimal. The SizeInMBs and IntervalInSeconds parameters are optional. However, if specify a value for one of them, you must also provide a value for the other.

Classes/AWSFirehoseCloudWatchLoggingOpti.name: AWSFirehoseCloudWatchLoggingOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseCloudWatchLoggingOpti.abstract: Describes the Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDataFormatConversionC.name: AWSFirehoseDataFormatConversionConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseDataFormatConversionC.abstract: Specifies that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to convert data from the JSON format to the Parquet or ORC format before writing it to Amazon S3. Kinesis Data Firehose uses the serializer and deserializer that you specify, in addition to the column information from the Amazon Web Services Glue table, to deserialize your input data from JSON and then serialize it to the Parquet or ORC format. For more information, see Kinesis Data Firehose Record Format Conversion.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncrypt.name: AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncrypt.abstract: Contains information about the server-side encryption (SSE) status for the delivery stream, the type customer master key (CMK) in use, if any, and the ARN of the CMK. You can get DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration by invoking the DescribeDeliveryStream operation.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncrypt.name: AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInput
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeliveryStreamEncrypt.abstract: Specifies the type and Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK to use for Server-Side Encryption (SSE).

Classes/AWSFirehoseDeserializer.html.name: AWSFirehoseDeserializer
Classes/AWSFirehoseDeserializer.html.abstract: The deserializer you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use for converting the input data from JSON. Kinesis Data Firehose then serializes the data to its final format using the Serializer. Kinesis Data Firehose supports two types of deserializers: the Apache Hive JSON SerDe and the OpenX JSON SerDe.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDestinationDescriptio.name: AWSFirehoseDestinationDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseDestinationDescriptio.abstract: Describes the destination for a delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDocumentIdOptions.htm.name: AWSFirehoseDocumentIdOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseDocumentIdOptions.htm.abstract: Indicates the method for setting up document ID. The supported methods are Kinesis Data Firehose generated document ID and OpenSearch Service generated document ID.

Classes/AWSFirehoseDynamicPartitioningCo.name: AWSFirehoseDynamicPartitioningConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseDynamicPartitioningCo.abstract: The configuration of the dynamic partitioning mechanism that creates smaller data sets from the streaming data by partitioning it based on partition keys. Currently, dynamic partitioning is only supported for Amazon S3 destinations.

Classes/AWSFirehoseElasticsearchBufferin.name: AWSFirehoseElasticsearchBufferingHints
Classes/AWSFirehoseElasticsearchBufferin.abstract: Describes the buffering to perform before delivering data to the Amazon ES destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseElasticsearchDestinat.name: AWSFirehoseElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseElasticsearchDestinat.abstract: Describes the configuration of a destination in Amazon ES.

Classes/AWSFirehoseElasticsearchDestinat.name: AWSFirehoseElasticsearchDestinationDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseElasticsearchDestinat.abstract: The destination description in Amazon ES.

Classes/AWSFirehoseElasticsearchDestinat.name: AWSFirehoseElasticsearchDestinationUpdate
Classes/AWSFirehoseElasticsearchDestinat.abstract: Describes an update for a destination in Amazon ES.

Classes/AWSFirehoseElasticsearchRetryOpt.name: AWSFirehoseElasticsearchRetryOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseElasticsearchRetryOpt.abstract: Configures retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver documents to Amazon ES.

Classes/AWSFirehoseEncryptionConfigurati.name: AWSFirehoseEncryptionConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseEncryptionConfigurati.abstract: Describes the encryption for a destination in Amazon S3.

Classes/AWSFirehoseExtendedS3Destination.name: AWSFirehoseExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseExtendedS3Destination.abstract: Describes the configuration of a destination in Amazon S3.

Classes/AWSFirehoseExtendedS3Destination.name: AWSFirehoseExtendedS3DestinationDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseExtendedS3Destination.abstract: Describes a destination in Amazon S3.

Classes/AWSFirehoseExtendedS3Destination.name: AWSFirehoseExtendedS3DestinationUpdate
Classes/AWSFirehoseExtendedS3Destination.abstract: Describes an update for a destination in Amazon S3.

Classes/AWSFirehoseFailureDescription.ht.name: AWSFirehoseFailureDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseFailureDescription.ht.abstract: Provides details in case one of the following operations fails due to an error related to KMS: CreateDeliveryStream, DeleteDeliveryStream, StartDeliveryStreamEncryption, StopDeliveryStreamEncryption.

Classes/AWSFirehoseHiveJsonSerDe.html.name: AWSFirehoseHiveJsonSerDe
Classes/AWSFirehoseHiveJsonSerDe.html.abstract: The native Hive / HCatalog JsonSerDe. Used by Kinesis Data Firehose for deserializing data, which means converting it from the JSON format in preparation for serializing it to the Parquet or ORC format. This is one of two deserializers you can choose, depending on which one offers the functionality you need. The other option is the OpenX SerDe.

Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointBuffering.name: AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointBufferingHints
Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointBuffering.abstract: Describes the buffering options that can be applied before data is delivered to the HTTP endpoint destination. Kinesis Data Firehose treats these options as hints, and it might choose to use more optimal values. The SizeInMBs and IntervalInSeconds parameters are optional. However, if specify a value for one of them, you must also provide a value for the other.

Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointCommonAtt.name: AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointCommonAttribute
Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointCommonAtt.abstract: Describes the metadata that’s delivered to the specified HTTP endpoint destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointConfigura.name: AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointConfigura.abstract: Describes the configuration of the HTTP endpoint to which Kinesis Firehose delivers data.

Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointDescripti.name: AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointDescripti.abstract: Describes the HTTP endpoint selected as the destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointDestinati.name: AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointDestinati.abstract: Describes the configuration of the HTTP endpoint destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointDestinati.name: AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointDestinationDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointDestinati.abstract: Describes the HTTP endpoint destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointDestinati.name: AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointDestinationUpdate
Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointDestinati.abstract: Updates the specified HTTP endpoint destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointRequestCo.name: AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointRequestConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointRequestCo.abstract: The configuration of the HTTP endpoint request.

Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointRetryOpti.name: AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointRetryOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseHttpEndpointRetryOpti.abstract: Describes the retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver data to the specified HTTP endpoint destination, or if it doesn’t receive a valid acknowledgment of receipt from the specified HTTP endpoint destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseInputFormatConfigurat.name: AWSFirehoseInputFormatConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseInputFormatConfigurat.abstract: Specifies the deserializer you want to use to convert the format of the input data. This parameter is required if Enabled is set to true.

Classes/AWSFirehoseKMSEncryptionConfig.h.name: AWSFirehoseKMSEncryptionConfig
Classes/AWSFirehoseKMSEncryptionConfig.h.abstract: Describes an encryption key for a destination in Amazon S3.

Classes/AWSFirehoseKinesisStreamSourceCo.name: AWSFirehoseKinesisStreamSourceConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseKinesisStreamSourceCo.abstract: The stream and role Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) for a Kinesis data stream used as the source for a delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseKinesisStreamSourceDe.name: AWSFirehoseKinesisStreamSourceDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseKinesisStreamSourceDe.abstract: Details about a Kinesis data stream used as the source for a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceConfiguratio.name: AWSFirehoseMSKSourceConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceConfiguratio.abstract: The configuration for the Amazon MSK cluster to be used as the source for a delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceDescription..name: AWSFirehoseMSKSourceDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseMSKSourceDescription..abstract: Details about the Amazon MSK cluster used as the source for a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseOpenXJsonSerDe.html.name: AWSFirehoseOpenXJsonSerDe
Classes/AWSFirehoseOpenXJsonSerDe.html.abstract: The OpenX SerDe. Used by Kinesis Data Firehose for deserializing data, which means converting it from the JSON format in preparation for serializing it to the Parquet or ORC format. This is one of two deserializers you can choose, depending on which one offers the functionality you need. The other option is the native Hive / HCatalog JsonSerDe.

Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html.name: AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe
Classes/AWSFirehoseOrcSerDe.html.abstract: A serializer to use for converting data to the ORC format before storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see Apache ORC.

Classes/AWSFirehoseOutputFormatConfigura.name: AWSFirehoseOutputFormatConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseOutputFormatConfigura.abstract: Specifies the serializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to convert the format of your data before it writes it to Amazon S3. This parameter is required if Enabled is set to true.

Classes/AWSFirehoseParquetSerDe.html.name: AWSFirehoseParquetSerDe
Classes/AWSFirehoseParquetSerDe.html.abstract: A serializer to use for converting data to the Parquet format before storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see Apache Parquet.

Classes/AWSFirehosePutRecordBatchRespons.name: AWSFirehosePutRecordBatchResponseEntry
Classes/AWSFirehosePutRecordBatchRespons.abstract: Contains the result for an individual record from a PutRecordBatch request. If the record is successfully added to your delivery stream, it receives a record ID. If the record fails to be added to your delivery stream, the result includes an error code and an error message.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRecord.html.name: AWSFirehoseRecord
Classes/AWSFirehoseRecord.html.abstract: The unit of data in a delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationCo.name: AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationCo.abstract: Describes the configuration of a destination in Amazon Redshift.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationUp.name: AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationUpdate
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftDestinationUp.abstract: Describes an update for a destination in Amazon Redshift.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftRetryOptions..name: AWSFirehoseRedshiftRetryOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseRedshiftRetryOptions..abstract: Configures retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver documents to Amazon Redshift.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRetryOptions.html.name: AWSFirehoseRetryOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseRetryOptions.html.abstract: The retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver data to an Amazon S3 prefix.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.name: AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationConfigur.abstract: Describes the configuration of a destination in Amazon S3.

Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.name: AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate
Classes/AWSFirehoseS3DestinationUpdate.h.abstract: Describes an update for a destination in Amazon S3.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSchemaConfiguration.h.name: AWSFirehoseSchemaConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseSchemaConfiguration.h.abstract: Specifies the schema to which you want Kinesis Data Firehose to configure your data before it writes it to Amazon S3. This parameter is required if Enabled is set to true.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSerializer.html.name: AWSFirehoseSerializer
Classes/AWSFirehoseSerializer.html.abstract: The serializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to convert data to the target format before writing it to Amazon S3. Kinesis Data Firehose supports two types of serializers: the ORC SerDe and the Parquet SerDe.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSourceDescription.htm.name: AWSFirehoseSourceDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseSourceDescription.htm.abstract: Details about a Kinesis data stream used as the source for a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSplunkBufferingHints..name: AWSFirehoseSplunkBufferingHints
Classes/AWSFirehoseSplunkBufferingHints..abstract: The buffering options. If no value is specified, the default values for Splunk are used.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSplunkDestinationConf.name: AWSFirehoseSplunkDestinationConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseSplunkDestinationConf.abstract: Describes the configuration of a destination in Splunk.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSplunkDestinationUpda.name: AWSFirehoseSplunkDestinationUpdate
Classes/AWSFirehoseSplunkDestinationUpda.abstract: Describes an update for a destination in Splunk.

Classes/AWSFirehoseSplunkRetryOptions.ht.name: AWSFirehoseSplunkRetryOptions
Classes/AWSFirehoseSplunkRetryOptions.ht.abstract: Configures retry behavior in case Kinesis Data Firehose is unable to deliver documents to Splunk, or if it doesn’t receive an acknowledgment from Splunk.

Classes/AWSFirehoseTag.html.name: AWSFirehoseTag
Classes/AWSFirehoseTag.html.abstract: Metadata that you can assign to a delivery stream, consisting of a key-value pair.

Classes/AWSFirehoseVpcConfiguration.html.name: AWSFirehoseVpcConfiguration
Classes/AWSFirehoseVpcConfiguration.html.abstract: The details of the VPC of the Amazon OpenSearch or Amazon OpenSearch Serverless destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseVpcConfigurationDescr.name: AWSFirehoseVpcConfigurationDescription
Classes/AWSFirehoseVpcConfigurationDescr.abstract: The details of the VPC of the Amazon ES destination.

Classes/AWSFirehoseRecorder.html.name: AWSFirehoseRecorder
Classes/AWSFirehoseRecorder.html.abstract: The AWSFirehoseRecorder is a high level client meant for storing put record requests on the user’s device. This allows developers to retain requests when the device is offline. It can also increase performance and battery efficiency since the Wi-Fi or cell network does not need to be woken up as frequently.

Classes/AWSFirehose.html.name: AWSFirehose
Classes/AWSFirehose.html.abstract:
Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose API Reference

Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose is a fully managed service that delivers real-time streaming data to destinations such as Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3), Amazon OpenSearch Service, Amazon Redshift, Splunk, and various other supportd destinations.

Classes/AWSKinesisHashKeyRange.html.name: AWSKinesisHashKeyRange
Classes/AWSKinesisHashKeyRange.html.abstract: The range of possible hash key values for the shard, which is a set of ordered contiguous positive integers.

Classes/AWSKinesisPutRecordsResultEntry..name: AWSKinesisPutRecordsResultEntry
Classes/AWSKinesisPutRecordsResultEntry..abstract: Represents the result of an individual record from a PutRecords request. A record that is successfully added to a stream includes SequenceNumber and ShardId in the result. A record that fails to be added to the stream includes ErrorCode and ErrorMessage in the result.

Classes/AWSKinesisRecord.html.name: AWSKinesisRecord
Classes/AWSKinesisRecord.html.abstract: The unit of data of the Kinesis data stream, which is composed of a sequence number, a partition key, and a data blob.

Classes/AWSKinesisSequenceNumberRange.ht.name: AWSKinesisSequenceNumberRange
Classes/AWSKinesisSequenceNumberRange.ht.abstract: The range of possible sequence numbers for the shard.

Classes/AWSKinesisShard.html.name: AWSKinesisShard
Classes/AWSKinesisShard.html.abstract: A uniquely identified group of data records in a Kinesis data stream.

Classes/AWSKinesisTag.html.name: AWSKinesisTag
Classes/AWSKinesisTag.html.abstract: Metadata assigned to the stream, consisting of a key-value pair.

Classes/AWSKinesisRecorder.html.name: AWSKinesisRecorder
Classes/AWSKinesisRecorder.html.abstract: The AWSKinesisRecorder is a high level client meant for storing put record requests on the user’s device. This allows developers to retain requests when the device is offline. It can also increase performance and battery efficiency since the Wi-Fi or cell network does not need to be woken up as frequently.

Classes/AWSKinesis.html.name: AWSKinesis
Classes/AWSKinesis.html.abstract:
Amazon Kinesis Data Streams Service API Reference

Amazon Kinesis Data Streams is a managed service that scales elastically for real-time processing of streaming big data.
